title: Chapel

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Chapel in a player-owned house is a room where the player can recharge Prayer and receive extra Prayer experience for bones.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Chapel
For a list of all items and upgrades within the Construction skill, see Construction/Level up table.
Chapel
Released31 May 2006 (Update)
Icon
Construction level45
Cost50,000
Door layout
Chapel

The Chapel in a player-owned house is a room where the player can recharge Prayer and receive extra Prayer experience for bones.

This room can be built with 45 Construction and 50,000.

There are 7 hotspots available:

  • Altar space
  • Icon space
  • Lamp space
  • Musical space
  • Rug space
  • Statue space
  • Window space

Contents

  • 1 Altar
  • 2 Lamps
  • 3 Icons
  • 4 Musical
  • 5 Statues
  • 6 Windows
  • 7 Rug
  • 8 Changes

Altar[edit | edit source]

Altars can be used to recharge Prayer points, and provide a place to sacrifice bones for greater Prayer experience than burying them.

Level Altar Materials Experience Cost XP multiplier with # of burners lit
0 1 2
45 Oak altar Oak plank x4 240 1,884 100% 150% 200%
50 Teak altar Teak plank x4 360 3,672 110% 160% 210%
56 Cloth altar Teak plank x4
Bolt of cloth x2 		390 5,586 125% 175% 225%
60 Mahogany altar Mahogany plank x4
Bolt of cloth x2 		590 10,566 150% 200% 250%
64 Limestone altar Mahogany plank x6
Bolt of cloth x2
Limestone brick x2 		910 15,240 175% 225% 275%
70 Marble altar Marble block x2
Bolt of cloth x2 		1,030 667,434 200% 250% 300%
75 Gilded altar Marble block x2
Bolt of cloth x2
Gold leaf x4 		2,230 1,203,730 250% 300% 350%

Lamps[edit | edit source]

Torches and candlesticks built in the lamp hotspot are purely decorative; however, incense burners built here can be lit to provide an extra 50% experience bonus each to the Prayer experience granted by sacrificing bones on the altar. With both lit, they provide a 100% experience bonus. Players must use a tinderbox to light the burners and must supply a clean marrentill for each burner.

There appear to be two lamp hotspots in the room, but building an item of furniture in either one will build it in both places at once. Therefore, players only need one set of materials.

Level Lamp Materials Experience Cost Prayer Boost
45 Steel torches Steel bar x2 40 886 No
49 Wooden torches Plank x2
Nails x2 		58 434 - 2,088[1] No
53 Steel candlesticks Steel bar x6
Candle x6 		124 4,344 No
57 Gold candlesticks Gold bar x6
Candle x6 		46 2,208 No
61 Oak incense burners Oak plank x4
Steel bar x2 		280 2,770 Yes
65 Mahogany incense burners Mahogany plank x4
Steel bar x2 		600 9,538 Yes
69 Marble incense burners Marble block x2
Steel bar x2 		1,600 666,406 Yes
  1. ↑ Cost changes depending on the type of nails used.

Icons[edit | edit source]

The chapel aligns to either Guthix, Saradomin, Zamorak, or Bob depending on the icon chosen. The default alignment is to Saradomin if no icon is built.

The icon that is built determines the theme of the furniture in the Chapel. For example, players with a Guthix icon will have Guthix's symbol on the Chapel's windows and on their altar. Players who have a Zamorak icon will have the statues be of Zamorak and will have Zamorak's symbol on their altar.

Level Icon Materials Experience Cost
45 Gnome child icon Oak plank x3
Gnome child icon 		100 1,413

Gold leaf x2 		960 271,820

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
28 November 2013
(update | poll)

Player-owned house incense burners can now be refuelled before they go out, provided you have some marrentill. This should help you prevent them expiring while you're in the middle of a batch of bones.

7 November 2013
(update | poll)

The smoke from an incense burner in a player-owned house is now green to make it more visible.

15 August 2013
(update | poll)

When you use bones on a player-owned house altar, you will have the option of letting all the other matching bones in your inventory be offered at the altar automatically.

22 February 2013
(update)

This content was included when the Old School RuneScape servers officially launched.
